name: eqiupment
html1:
Go-Forth Pest Control and Lake Norman Pest Control

Company Cell Phone Contract

Go-Forth Pest Control

Company Cell Phone, Uniform & Equipment Contract

By initialing beside each item and signing the bottom of this form, I agree that I have received the following items for company use. I agree that they were in full working condition when I received them. I understand that I have two (2) weeks to notify management of any problems with my equipment and uniforms. After that period, any problems will be assumed to be due to fault of my own following my use of the items. I understand that upon my departure from Go-Forth, if any of these items are not turned in or are not in the same working condition as they were upon my receipt of them, then I will responsible for replacing them, the cost of which will be withheld from my final paycheck. It is my responsibility to have the general wear-and-tear of these items corrected DURING my employment when the wear-and-tear occurs—if it is not brought to management’s attention until my departure from Go-Forth, then I will be responsible for replacing them.

I understand that all of my company property must be returned and inventoried the same day of my separation. All items not returned the day of the separation will be considered stolen if they are not returned by a pre-determined scheduled date agreed upon by a department manager (ex. structural pest division manager, office manager or Chase or Leah Hazelwood), and therefore GO-FORTH will reserve the right to either file a police report noting the items as stolen and press charges, or withhold the replacement value of those items from any future paychecks, or do both.

Phone-Related Items

Uniform Items

Equipment

Vehicle-Related Items

By signing below, I agree to all of the following conditions regarding the use of Company phones, and understand that if I fail to follow these guidelines that it can be grounds for me to lose the privilege of having a Company phone and/or for my termination from the Company.

  1. You must stay within the allotted number of minutes (if applicable under whatever plan we are under) under the plan that has been designated. If not you will pay whatever fees are associated with your overages. You agree to have it withheld from your next paycheck.
  2. You must stay under 4 Gigabytes of data usage on the phone. Every (each) Gigabyte in excess of 4 Gb for which our cell provider claims you have used, will result in $15 per Gb and you agree to have it withheld from your next paycheck.
  3. No warning will be provided for your data usage. You have ways of tracking data on your device. If you are unaware of how to do so, you hereby agree to search out training for how to track your data within 2 weeks of signing this agreement. You must request this training in writing.
  4. Texting or emailing while driving ANY vehicle is strictly prohibited.
  5. The cell phone may not be used for ANY inappropriate communications at any time. This is including but not limited to any pornographic, racist, sexist, vulgar, rude, discriminatory communication ​or ​otherwise offensive texts, emails, photos, videos. This includes but is not limited to sexual orientation or gender identity. Misuse of a Company-issued phone for such offensive communications is grounds for termination.
  6. Phone conversations or any communications that are subversive or derogatory toward co-workers or the Company will also not be permitted. This includes but is not limited to all points listed above for line 5. Misuse of a Company-issued phone for such offensive communications is grounds for termination.
  7. The camera/video function of the cell phone may be used for business purposes ONLY. Secret photos or videos of coworkers or customers are prohibited. Misuse of a Company-issued phone for unapproved photographic use is grounds for termination. Use of any other photographic device in these ways is also prohibited including a personal cell phone.
  8. Go-Forth owns not only the cell phone but also anything on the cell phone. We reserve the right to search the phone or its communications history at any time.
  9. Do not change the root programming of the phone or alternative operating systems etc. (do not “root” your phone or “jailbreak” etc.) This will result in the phone being considered broken beyond operation. (See page 4)
  10. I have two (2) weeks to notify management of any problems with my phone. After that period, any problems will be assumed to be due to fault of my own following my use of the phone.

I agree that I have received the following items for my use. I also agree to the financial terms listed here:

  1. I agree to keep this phone in complete working order during my employment. At the end of my employment, I will turn my phone over to management, in the same condition which it was received or else pay the replacement cost.
  2. Phone replacement cost is $600 at the time of this agreement. I agree to have this amount withheld from my final paycheck or turn the phone in undamaged on my final date of employment.
  3. If I lose or damage my phone during my employment, I agree to have $20 per month withheld from my pay each month for 24 consecutive months. This is broken into a maximum of 2 payments per month ($10 per payments) with the balance of payments due out of my final paycheck if my employment should end.
  4. If I damage another phone before paying off the first phone, I agree to pay the entire balance of my first phone and have it withheld from my next paycheck.
  5. It will be the intention of management to minimize these expenses and in the event that a suitable alternative should come available, that alternative can be approved by the current owner of Go-Forth and its subsidiaries at that time.
  6. Special exemption for employees with a record of keeping their phone in good working order and or turning them in, unbroken: If an employee has the following apply.

6.1. They have 2 consecutive years from the moment of the incident of keeping a company issued phone from Go-Forth without a loss or damage of any kind regardless of fault.

6.2. In the event of a lost or stolen phone the employee must file a police report and provide the report to Go-Forth.

6.3. In the event of a lost or stolen phone the employee must report, to their immediate supervisor, the phone lost within 24 hours of the loss of the phone. This 24 hours includes weekends or holidays as well. (not just the next business day, we will want to attempt to locate the phone).

6.4. In the event of a damaged phone,the employee must turn in the damaged phone and damage report must be issued in writing at the next immediate moment of business. i.e. if the phone were broken during work, you would immediately find a way to notify your manager, if the phone were broken on a weekend, you would notify your manager at 7:30 AM the next business day. (in this case, NOT on the weekend or holiday)

6.5. In the event of either a lost or damaged phone, the employee must turn in a written action plan describing how the loss or damage occurred and how they will prevent future damage or loss from occurring.

6.6. In the event that an employee should break another phone, please refer to 6.1. It will be 2 years of consecutive employment without a loss or damage before he or she would be eligible for the exemption again.

If all conditions of 6-6.6 are met, the tenured employee will not be charged in the event they break their phone, and will only be charged $300 if their phone were to become lost or stolen.
